oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Chucalissa Museum Park
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Native Americans at Chucalissa Museum/Park, making handicrafts, color image.

“Family Handicrafts - Chucalissa Pre-Historic Indian Town -- This famous Archeological Ruin – now a State Park – is under development by an archeologist, and is open to public the year ‘round. (Closed on Mondays). It is though that this ancient town was once occupied by Indians very much like the Chickasaw and Choctaw as they were first known to Europeans. The town itself was an important ceremonial center. Located west of U. S. Highway 61, just south of Memphis, Tennessee. For additional information, write: Division Of State Parks, Cordell Hull Bldg., Nashville 3, Tennessee”
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Chucalissa Museum; Native Americans; museums; parks; Fuller State Park;
